page.title: 03Farming-Agriculture crops
page.content: The average size of farm is approx 300 acres, and about 50% of the land is cultivated. The crops grown are autumn and spring sown barley and wheat, with some oats for sheep and horse feed. Some of the barley is sold for malting, otherwise the cereals are used for stockfeed on the farm or are sold to merchants. A proportion of the crops are exported through the ports of Newcastle, Blyth or Berwick. Cereal yields are:- barley 3_4 tonnes per acre, wheat 4_5 tonnes per acre, oilseeed rape is sown as a break crop and yields approx 1.25 tonnes. On average each farm has 2 staff,3 tractors, and 1/2 combine harvester.
